greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of gcd(n,k) for k = 1 to n-1.
comment: This sequence for a(n) also arises in the following context. If f(x) is a monic univariate polynomial of degree d>1 over Zn (= Z/nZ, the ring of integers modulo n), and we let X be the number of distinct roots of f(x) in Zn taken over all n^d choices for f(x), then the variance Var[X] = a(n)/n and the expected value E[X] = 1. - _Michael Monagan_, Sep 11 2015
reference: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2000
M. Le Brun, Email to N. J. A. Sloane, Jul 1991
Michael Monagan, Baris Tuncer, Some results on counting roots of polynomials and the Sylvester resultant, arXiv:1609.08712 [math.CO], (27-September-2016).
formula: a(p) = p-1 for a prime p.
a(n) = A018804(n)-n = Sum_{ d divides n } (d-1)*phi(n/d). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, May 04 2002
G.f.: Sum_{k>=1} phi(k) * x^(2*k) / (1 - x^k)^2. - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Feb 06 2020
results.author: _Marc LeBrun_
ext: More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, May 04 2002
